review: Trulicity (dulaglutide):I’m reviewing for my husband. He was first prescribed Trulicity as a pre-diabetic and to help him lose a little weight since it is a known side effect.He’s been on it for about 5 months now. He’s lost close to 100 pounds and his numbers are great.However, he has had terrible stomach pain, diarrhea, vomiting and cramping. That’s not even the worst of it. He is experiencing severe emotional outbursts, manic behavior that has caused him to lose his job and it is playing a severe traumatic strain on our marriage.This medication is more addictive than most illicit drugs. He tends to take his dose a day sooner every week to get the revved up feeling he gets the first few days after a new injection. He will stay awake for days at a time and is extremely fidgety to where he cannot sit still and must be doing something.He already suffers from alcoholism on top of it and this medication seems to amplify it. I cannot stress enough the dangers of this medication.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):Trulicity has been good and bad. I had nausea for a little bit seems to hit in the evening time time on the 0.05 dose. Then got upped to 1.5 then I became very constipated ended up in the hospital but then ate some beans that help that. Then was up to 3.0 I was very, very sick very constipated, vomiting so then ate beans again and then was sick with very bad diarrhea for about 4 days. My doctor moved me back down to the 1.5 and it been good my body seems more comfortable at the 1.5 no constipation or diarrhea. I don't have a gallbladder so I like the injection because it has slowed down my digestive system. My blood sugar is low and my bowels are normal. I started in Nov. I still eat low carb and treat myself here and there. Just had my blood work done so I don't know yet what my a1c is since starting Trulicity but I have lost 32lb. I'm so thankful for that I have more to go and I will get there. But I do not have all these cravings for food and I eat only eat half of what a normal proportion would be because I am full.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):Started taking Trulicity 1.5mg November 2021, as Metformin was no longer working.It's taken about four months, and it certainly worked wonders on my sugar levels... but now, 2 days after the injection, I am vomiting and having the worst bouts of diarrhea. It is so bad, that I have lost 4kg within 24 hours, on two occasions.Definitely getting in touch with the Dr. to come off this terrible medication!

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I just switched from Metformin to Trulicity. I have already seen a huge difference. Love not having to take pills everyday. The injection doesn’t hurt one bit. My levels have also dropped and I am not as hungry. Thankfully, I haven’t had any side effects, yet. So glad there are so many options to help combat this disease. Can’t wait to see my improvements when I’m on it longer. Feeling great!

Trulicity (dulaglutide):Started 3 weeks ago, I take 1.5 every week and so far have had no side effects and after reading reviews here before starting I was prepared beforehand with anti nausea medication from Dr. I waited three days and braced myself for onslaught but nothing and I am so pleased. I do take Omperazole so I wonder if that has helped me? Anyway I am waiting 3 months to see about improvements. My sugar levels are great, probably better than most people without type 2. But I achieved that thru diet alone but as I am having surgery towards the end of the year I needed to get them down and now I want them to stay down and I need to loose weight in order to please my Dr to give the go ahead for the surgery hence the swap from Jardiance to Trulicity.  As for insurance question. In NZ this drug is funded so is basically free ($5 for 3 months supply)

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I was on trulicity for five weeks unfortunately one of the side effects is pancreatitis. Which I developed so I can no longer take this medication or anything like it. I was told the vomiting and nausea was normal and would go away after a few weeks. When the symptoms  didn’t stop my wife got involved made the doctor do testing pancreatitis and they found pancreatitis. The doctor thanks my wife for her diagnosis and that I could no longer take this medication or anything like it moving forward. In the short time I was taking it my numbers dropped 60 points I am very disappointed that my body would not tolerate this. I think it works really well if your body will tolerate it. Good luck to you

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I have been taking the starting dosage for 5 weeks and it's working pretty well so far not a lot of weight loss. I've only loss 8 pounds have not drop clothing sizes yet. So overall it's a go for me.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I am type 2 diabetic currently on metformin & glimmerpride twice a day.  My blood sugar readings when fasten is above 249.  Recently been having lot of problems with my pancreas function and kidneys.  Even being on diabetic meds my sugar remain high.  I was getting protein spilling in my urine.  This is the 4 day being on trulicity.  I was more nervous about injecting myself with trulicity then it really was.  I read all the reviews I was scared of the side effects.  I didn’t look forward to vomiting and being nauseated.  So far I didn’t notice feeling sick I feel calmer being on it.  I did notice that I felt a little more tired.  Normally I would eat at night and so far I notice my appetite has been suppressed.  I believe it reacts differently to every person.  With my health conditions it was worth a try.  Don’t read all the reviews that make you scared.  Give it a chance because it may save your life.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I started Trulicity at 9AM on 2/6/22 and was very hopeful that I'd be able to tolerate it. No such luck. By 6PM I was experiencing a very rapid heart rate (165bpm, and it's gone as high as 178) and my blood pressure was 158/105. I'm already on 20mg of lisinopril and was having ideal BP. Every time I'd move I'd feel so horrible. Heart beating out of my chest, fatigued, heavy breathing. I also can't eat. Yesterday I had to force a snack cup of jello and some chicken broth after 5pm because I hadn't ate. I have waves of fullness and nausea every 5 minutes or so. I talked to my endocrinologist yesterday 2/7/22 and was prescribed a beta blocker for my heart rate and blood pressure. It seems to be working, but I don't like that I need it. Hopefully only 5 more days of this... I know people Trulicity has worked wonders for, I'm just not one of them. If your heart rate or bp goes up significantly, please call a doctor, it is listed as a serious side effect, and a week is a long time to wait.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I been on it for two weeks with NO side effects so far. I don't get sick or have diarrhea/ constipation. This is an amazing drug because my sugar numbers are always lower than usual now and my appetite decreased a lot. I eat all the time but not anymore. This is too good to be true. We will see how long this goodness last, at least for me.

Doctor increased my dose, and I threw up after the dose change.  Then still hungry. I can eat then I want to eat again between 1-3 hours after. We have been appealing with my insurance to get onto Ozempic.  It is a much better drug and zero hunger when I was on it for 6 weeks.  If we cannot get approved I will move to Trulicity 4.5 mg. Trulicity (dulaglutide):After Metformin was no longer keeping my numbers down, my doctor suggested we add a new medication.  He gave me a sack full of free samples of Trulicity.  He said it was wonderful and should get me back in line.  I started out on the lower doses, then eventually went to the 1.5 dosage, until my numbers started creeping up again.  That was about the same time that the 3.0 & 4.0 dosages had first been approved.  I was put on the 3.0 dose.  It brought my numbers back down, but the side effects were magnified and became intolerable.  Ended up with heartburn so bad, I started having to take daily heartburn medication.  Then I started having severe episodes of what I initially thought was food poisoning.  I had sulfur burps with severe vomiting and diarrhea so bad, I had to wear adult diapers during those episodes.  Turned out to be medicine-induced gastroparesis and pancreatitis.  The once weekly shot was convenient, but not worth the horrific pain & suffering it caused.

I can't complain about the medication.  All anti-diabetic agents cause the stomach issues.  Hang in there.

I have literally had 5 crackers & a piece of toast in three days. Vomiting, horrible belching & abdominal pain & still more diarrhea.  I am fighting to stay hydrated. I have upset stomach with Metformin, so I should have know that this would cause problems. I'm convinced that the reason you lose weight with this, is because you can't eat at all! I won't be taking a dose this week.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I'm a horrible diabetic.  I eat anything I want and never check my sugar. I've been on Trulicity for approx. 8 mos and I think its a  wonder drug.  My A1C was 7 and I eat sweets and quit exercising because of surgery and it still went down. I take 26U of Levemir  but guessing that will be cut down. I didn't realize the Trulicity dose had been increased two months ago, but am relieved to know. I thought I was dying due to uncontrolled diarrhea and public accidents. Horrifying, but am adjusting to increased dose and can't wait until next week to see what my A1C is. I hate taking medication and do have side effects, but usually adjust after a period and feel pretty good. Much better than having an A1C over 9, and high sugars. Don't give up.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):This is day 2 for me.  I had a little nausea today. I am trying really hard to get off of insulin. I hope this works. I was on victoza for 4 years so I  am used to nausea and stomach issues.
Trulicity (dulaglutide):Been on this med 3 weeks .Experienced slight nausea daily no impact on sugar levels .

Trulicity (dulaglutide):Have taken the lowest dosage for about a month, supplementing 2000mg Metformin and 8mg glimeperide daily. Occasional minor nausea and heartburn, no vomiting or diarrhea. Morning readings were 140s-200s, now typically 70s-90s, with one reading of 118. Readings 2 hours after breakfast are still usually higher than I would like, often above 220. Mostly pleased with results, will be consulting with my doctors soon.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I have been on Trulicity for almost 8 months now. I did have a lot of nausea that little by little   improved over time. I have very little nausea at this point. So went back to the .75 and  it's enough to keep my numbers where they need to be. In fact I am off all other diabetes medications now (was on Latus and Meteformin)

Trulicity (dulaglutide):This drug Trulicity has been a nightmare for me. Trulicity (dulaglutide):No appreciable effect on A1c levels. A lot of money for no return.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I started Trulicity three days ago.  No vomiting yet but just low levelnausea and slight depression. Sugar went down 111 and low appetite.Concerned about future especially depression aspect.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):This my 6th week with Trulicity. First week was terrible. Nausea, breathing problem, loss of appetite, stomach trouble, weakness. If present condition holds and if my A1c drops to near 7 or so, I am inclined to use Trulicity. Am using .75/.5 dose.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):Been on T for about 6 weeks.  No nausea, and about an 8 lb. weight loss.  Morning readings sometimes in the seventies.  I take 17 units of Levemir at bedtime, but  morning readings have never been as good until I started on Trulicity. It  replaced a daily shot of Victoza, max dose, for which I am grateful. I am awaiting my first A1c test results to see if I can finally go under 7.0 at last. . A couple of notes necessary here:  Not expecting drugs I take (including Januvia, Metformin Repaglinide plus the injectables) to produce miracles. All working for me.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I have been on Trulicity for 4 weeks. Had been in the hospital for a week on heavy antiboitics. Now on .75 dose and levels run around 120s. Worry about long term use..I go off it for a week and levels creep back up.

Trulicity (dulaglutide):I have been on this medication for the last month. I had been taking up to 50 units of Novolog and 50 units of Levemir. 1000 mg of metformin and 300 mg of Invokana. I have decreased my insulin to just a few injections a day. I am more than satisfied!

Trulicity (dulaglutide):Been taking trulicity for about a month now. I haven't had any weight loss and I'm not sure how it effected my a1c yet.
